etymology.description: 网(网) (wǎng, "net") + 貝(貝) (bèi, "money cowrie") = capturing with a net and valuables -> buy
etymology.interpretation: The traditional character 買(買) (mǎi, "buy") depicts a net used to capture valuable items, represented by the cowrie shell, indicating the exchange process of purchasing. This combines physical capture with the notion of economic transaction, effectively illustrating the concept of buying.
etymology.simplification: The traditional character 買(買) (mǎi, "buy") was simplified to 买(買) by removing the 财(財) (cái, "wealth") radical and using a modified net component.

examples.chinese: 我去超市(我去超市)，买水果(買水果)。
examples.english: I go to the supermarket to buy fruits.

examples.chinese: 她想买新衣服(她想買新衣服)。
examples.english: She wants to buy new clothes.

examples.chinese: 他们准备买票(他們準備買票)，去看电影(去看電影)。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen zhǔnbèi mǎi piào, qù kàn diànyǐng.
examples.english: They are ready to buy tickets to go watch a movie.
